intro: Eriolaena kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi eriolaena, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. It has been studied for its potential medicinal properties due to the presence of various bioactive compounds. However, it remains a relatively understudied species in terms of its full botanical and ecological significance.
